availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Underhill (Warren County, Kentucky, laborer, farmer, and soldier.)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, laborer, farmer, and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Samuel Underhill and Margaret Underhill. Married to Elizabeth Hendrick Underhill in Warren County, Kentucky, on May 19, 1853. Father of William P. Underhill. Laborer in Warren County in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Served in the 52nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from October 10, 1863 to January 18, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District No 2, pp. 127A-127B
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District No 1, p. 810.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Lucas Precinct, p. 214B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000339890.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0454.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 512.
"John William Underhill (1831-1906)," Find A Grave, Memorial #99768899, accessed June 30, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99768899/john-william-underhill.
